headline: Tyson (TSN) Price-Fixing Settlement: Taking Stock of the Company’s Valuation After the Legal Resolution
summary: Tyson Foods (TSN) just agreed to pay $55 million as part of an $87.5 million antitrust settlement over alleged beef price fixing, a move that closes one chapter but opens fresh questions for investors. See our latest analysis for Tyson Foods. The settlement lands as Tyson’s share price sits at $58.04, with a 90 day share price return of 7.18% suggesting improving sentiment even as lawsuits, shifting demand, and trade actions like China’s beef quotas keep risk perceptions in flux, and long...
